lexUnit.name: virtuosity.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: great skill in music or another artistic pursuit

sentence.text: The simplistic edges succeeded in highlighting the strength of the songwriting , the virtuosity of Johnny Marr 's guitar work and the gradual coming together of four musicians with one purpose .
The virtuosity of the wind players of the Chamber Orchestra of Europe is more effortless , and their accents far lighter in touch than that of their Swiss colleagues .
The brilliance of the book design is matched by the virtuosity of the printing by Dai Nippon .
The headmaster wielded that pause with all the virtuosity of Edith Evans in her prime .
Her virtuosity with language is not in doubt ( and all credit to her translator for rendering it with such vitality ) .

The first , featuring the American adolescent altoist , Christopher Hollyday , was uneven -- Hollyday 's famous virtuosity sounding faintly stiff and cramped by comparison with the local prodigy , Jason Rebello 's .
His virtuosity and clarity is a welcome oasis in the current clouded debate : whither modern architecture ?
One can only suppose that the smiths at Igbo Ukwu enjoyed demonstrating their virtuosity .
If the NBC Symphony 's virtuosity is already breathtaking in the first and second movements , then the finale is still more amazing in its precision , weight and attack .
Beneath the chandeliers of the Spanish Riding School , they display their virtuosity to the music of Mozart .
His performance is sui generis -- extraordinarily vivid in colour and gesture , at no small cost to the music 's continuity , and with no little virtuosity from the balance engineer .
The young Chinese-American Frederic Chiu displays spectacular virtuosity , glitter and panache , as well as deep sensitivity and thought in this , a most enterprising and important recording d√Ωt .

Steve Pratt Bournemouth Sinfonietta and Evelyn Glennie : Newcastle City Hall TYNESIDE is already familiar with the awesome virtuosity and musicianship of Evelyn Glennie and the audience welcomed her return to the city .
Perhaps the greatest attraction of the band is due to the extremely wide-ranging nature of it s repertoire and the virtuosity and versatility of it s members .
